intro: Scirpus parvinux, commonly known as the small-flowered bulrush, is a wetland plant native to North America. It is a perennial herb that grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant has tall, slender stems that bear small, clustered spikes of greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a slightly hairy texture. Scirpus parvinux plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
